ViqueiraQRNN.gradients_and_costs.GradientMethod

class ViqueiraQRNN.gradients_and_costs.GradientMethod(choose_method: str = 'finite_differences')

Bases: object

Callable class that handles all methods to calculate the gradient for the EMCZ algorithm.

Methods

GradientMethod.__init__(choose_method: str = 'finite_differences')
Parameters:

choose_method (str) – string describing the method that should be used. Default: finite_differences

GradientMethod.distr_shots(time_series, theta, shots: int = 2000)

Evaluation of the QRNN circuit with the given parameters, distributing shots. The combined result is stored in the attribute reference.

GradientMethod.finite_differences(time_series: numpy.array, theta_now: numpy.array, y_true: numpy.array, cost_func: CostFunction, diff: float | None = 1e-07, shots: int = 2000)

Finite differences method for calculating the gradient. It estimates the derivative on each component of the gradient, parallelizing the calculation between QPUs.

Parameters:

  • circuit (<class CircuitQRNN>) – the gradient of the parameters of this circuit will be computed. It iseeded for the .parameters() method that creates the right parameter order

  • qjobs (list[<class cunqa.qjob>]) – qjob objects representing the QPUs to which we submitted circuit. Use .upgrade_parameters() on them to input the desired parameters

  • time_series (np.array) – information of the time series being considered

  • theta_now (np.array) – initial value of theta at which to calculate the gradient

  • y_true (np.array) – true label that circuit should produce from time_series

  • cost_func (<class CostFunction>) – function that calculates the loss

  • diff (float) – small difference to put on each coordinate to calculate derivatives

Returns:

array of lenght len(theta_now) with the estimated gradient of theta

Return type:

gradient (np.array)

GradientMethod.gradient_with_bias()
GradientMethod.init_evaluation(circuit, time_series, theta, shots: int = 2000)

First evaluation of the QRNN circuit with the given parameters, distributing shots. QJobs are initialized and the combined result is stored in the attribute reference.

GradientMethod.parameter_shift_rule(circuit: CircuitQRNN, qjobs: list[cunqa.qjob.QJob], time_series: numpy.array, theta_now: numpy.array, y_true: numpy.array, cost_func: CostFunction, shots: int = 2000)

Parameter shift rule method for estimating the gradient of continuous parameters of quantum circuits. Based on the formula grad_{theta}f(x; theta) = [f(x; theta + pi/2) + f(x; theta - pi/2)]/2 for quantum functions.

Parameters:

  • circuit (<class CircuitQRNN>) – the gradient of the parameters of this circuit will be computed. It iseeded for the .parameters() method that creates the right parameter order

  • qjobs (list[<class cunqa.qjob>]) – qjob objects representing the QPUs to which we submitted circuit. Use .upgrade_parameters() on them to input the desired parameters

  • time_series (np.array) – information of the time series being considered

  • theta_now (np.array) – initial value of theta at which to calculate the gradient

  • y_true (np.array) – true label that circuit should produce from time_series

  • cost_func (<class CostFunction>) – function that calculates the loss

Returns:

array of lenght len(theta_now) with the estimated gradient of theta

Return type:

gradient (np.array)

GradientMethod.update_gradient_method(new_gradient_method)
